ai.summary: A scenic 11.1 km loop combining Drummy Woods with a historic stone circle. The hike weaves through woodland tracks with open sections and gentle elevation, suitable for a moderate level of fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily forest paths through Drummy Woods with some uneven roots and muddy patches. Expect grassy clearings and a short stretch near the stone circle where footing may be uneven around stones. The route is mostly easy to moderate, with occasional gentle climbs.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots and waterproofs; check weather and daylight. Stay on marked paths; watch for slippery stones and rooty sections after rain. Ticks can be present in woodland; carry insect repellent and inspect. Bring a map or GPS, inform someone of your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (waterproof jacket and warm layer)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline map and a full battery
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for the best weather and daylight; year-round with proper gear, though winter can be muddy and exposed.

seo.title: Drummy Woods and Stone Circle – 11.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Drummy Woods loop to a historic stone circle on an 11.1 km moderate hike in the UK. Woodlands, trails and ancient landscape.
seo.h1: Drummy Woods and Stone Circle — 11.1 km Moderate Hike
